Reviews.Title: “A charming old Hotel near the Underground and Kurfurstendamm”
Reviews.Author: DaveSenior
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for 5 days. The double bedroom was a generous size for the money with high ceilings. A table and chairs were provided. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom with shower was a reasonable size and everything worked. The buffet breakfast was more than adequate with a good selection available. You could easily fill yourself up for the day ahead! The breakfast room was light and airy with large windows . A computer connected to the internet was provided for guests near the reception. We found an interesting selection of small shops near the Hotel. We also visited a Greek Restaurant nearby which was very good value. It is a short walk to the underground and the main shopping street Kurfurstendamm.

Reviews.Title: “Basic for a weekend in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Jags_On_Tour
Reviews.Content: This is not for a romantic weekend break in Berlin. This is a functional hotel which offer a bedroom with en suite and buffet continental breakfast. The hotel is a 10 minute stroll from Charlottenburg Station (S-Bahn which is the overground) and 5 minutes from Adenauerplatz (U-bahn which is the underground) although we always used the S-Bahn as it is quicker and more convenient for where we are going. Despite offering 24 hour service, we experienced reluctance from the reception desk for our check out at 6:30 (required for travel) although this may have been the specific individual. The shower holder in the shower did not work (necessitating this being held to shower) and despite reporting to reception this was never fixed. [All that was needed was a screwdriver to tighten the screw - or potentially a replacement - but the concept was lost on the team at reception.] It is only a short walk to the History of Berlin (worth a visit) and the Sightseeing Bus which leaves from Kurfürstendamm. Be warned there are long queues to get on the bus - and even longer ones to get on the Boat Trip (badly managed by a short tempered bloke!). I would suggest you take a separate boat trip. The sightseeing tour does take in all the key sights. Also worth a visit is the Reichstag but note you have to book your appointment in advance and you must take photo id (you need to go through a tight security check much like the airports to get in). We went for a Hertha Berlin game at the Olympic Stadium which is very impressive. You can tour the stadium up until 6pm for €8 and the infrastructure for getting to/from games also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “very bad!!”
Reviews.Author: najibaal G
Reviews.Content: We were shocked by this hotel which does not deserve more than one star if any. It has been built in the last century for sure, lifts are very old, bad smell inside, staff not helpful (we made reservation for 2 superior double-bed rooms and had one triple room and another twin-bed room, although well-mentioned in our reservation, they told us that the only 2 real double-bed rooms were already occupied) It is important to precise that the two single beds cannot be brought together (mattresses remain 8 cm apart). Hotel is not very far from metro (around 10 min walking) and from bus (5 min) but it is not close to the center. It is situated near a high-class shopping street. Breakfast is generous (milk, coffee, juice, sausages, ham, cheese, bread, honey, eggs, yogurt). Rooms are very spacious, mattress not bad but overall impression is bad!

Reviews.Title: “For a 3-star hotel I suppose it was OK.”
Reviews.Author: hille96
Reviews.Content: Our room was big, high ceiling and high windows, black wooden furniture and black leather sofa. Not too appealing to the eye. Bathroom was clean as was the room, reading light was only for one bed, which was not good. Breakfast was ok. Under the TV there was a minibar warm and smelly and empty.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel, no frills, but useful extras”
Reviews.Author: vpexplores
Reviews.Content: On a bus route from the main airport was a useful starter and although the room was fairly basic it was large enough for 3 adults to spread out in, although there was only one chair available. Our room did not have a balcony and nor would any of the rooms on the front of the building. With the windows open there was a fair amount of road noise, but as the ventilation system was inadequate, we generally tolerated this. The breakfast was very comprehensive and everyone seemed to consume large portions. The food was replenished rapidly and even when we ate late there was plenty. Reception staff were courteous and it was useful being able to print off check in tickets for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Whatever_Mars
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a beautiful quiet area, close to metro station (u-bahn in german) Adenauerplatz and near to the Kurfurstedamm Venue, where there are a lot of fashion shops, gifts shops and places where you can taste the berliner food. The staff was 24h available. The room was very nice, bright and comfortably. The breakfast was very...german but if I have to choose I would definitively go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: ackcdg_123
Reviews.Content: We had a really warm smelly room, with no airco. Windows were broken, so it was hard to open a window. Hotel is above a restaurant with live music, so if you do open the window it is really noisy. Bathroom was dirty and smelly. Room was next to the kitchen en breakfast room so very noisy in the morning. Breakfast was good and location is nice. But don't expect much of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location, perfect for its money”
Reviews.Author: YuliaShakhavn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to one of the main streets of Berlin - Ku'damm (the Kurfürstendamm). Also it takes just a few minutes to get to bus stops and the place is just a couple of bus stops away from the Zoo central station. There are a lot of cafe's and restaurants nearby. While the hotel has the excellent location, its rooms are not so perfect. Furniture is rather old, standard rooms are small and oppressive. There was no Wi-Fi internet in rooms, so we had to use ancient PCs at the reception in order to check transport schedule. But still this hotel is the best choice for tourists who prefer to explore the city attractions and not the hotel. I would choose this hotel for my next stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, very friendly and a real bargain.”
Reviews.Author: Mammy12
Reviews.Content: I have now visited this hotel twice - once three years ago, and last week, and on both occassions I was not disappointed. It's clean, the staff are friendly and I think you'll find that the hotel in general is incredibly good value for money. On top of that is the fantastic location, not only for getting around once you're there, but also because of it's proximity to Charlottenburg railways station, and the Airport Express from Shoenenfeld Airport. Just to pick up on a points made in the other posts. Well a group of kids stayed there the last night we were there, and, unlike, the other reviewer, we didn't hear a peep out of them. Perhaps they were well behaved, or perhaps the person who wrote their review was being a tad petty. I paid next to nothing to stay three nights - it's a good, basic hotel, providing you with a base to explore a wonderful city. If you want to stay in the lap of luxury, I suggest you stump up the extra 200 quid a night.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel does not belong to Agon Group any more”
Reviews.Author: roxyviva
Reviews.Content: The hotel entrance, reception and lifts are very shabby and quite dirty. The room I had was lovely. It was very clean and bright. I was also lucky enough to have a room with a balcony. It's in a good location. The bus from the airport stops about five minutes away. My arrival coincided with the first day of the new owners so the staff didn't quite know if they were coming or going. They did their utmost to be polite and friendly. For meals and beer I can recommend the Xantener Eck Restaurant on Xantener Street which is about a five minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Never go here if there are school parties staying at the same time”
Reviews.Author: robbly
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel four times in the last three years and although basic it always provided a good breakfast and the rooms are clean. You get what you pay for as usual, the location is good for buses and U-Bahn with plenty of varied places nearby to eat. However when I stayed at this hotel last week we were on the top floor with four school parties of Italian students, girls on the fifth floor and boys on the fourth with their teachers. We only managed one good nights sleep and that was the day before we left as by then the students had gone. The worst night was the one beforethey all left, no sleep until 4.30 am. This was despite getting the night staff to ask the students to be quiet and me shouting at them, they would be quiet for a while then be out again in the corridoors chastting away as if it was mid day.Despite complaining every morning the hotel seemed unable to get a grip with the problem, I was not the only one complaining and usually takes a lot to make me do so. It spoiled our stay there and as if the noise wasn't bad enough the breakfast had been changed to a poorer standard with not too much variety but because of the large amount of students there if you didn't get down early there was hardly anything left.Will definitely not be staying there again. The hotel is under new management and they need to control their hotel more robustly.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: annemetal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and sisters. Our first impressions were not good. The reception area is old and small and the recepcionist, tough polite, was not friendly at all. Our floor were all occupied by doctors rooms along smelly and dark corridors, like a terror movie. The room was very old, the tv very small and old and the remote control was not working. The bed linen was white and clean. The matrimonial bed has two mattress side by side, and my mattress's husband was unconfortable. The breakfast was adequate, with lots of options to eat and drink, though the staff seemed unfriendly. The only positive thing about the hotel was the location. It was only 10 minutes walk to the main shopping area, Kurfurstendaam. I would not reccomend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “snowy january”
Reviews.Author: allandb9
Reviews.Content: cheap budget hotel £33 a night for b&b for double room good location near to bus and tube lines main railway line the zoolinger train station about 11/2 miles away (6 euros in a taxi) with good train connection to the airport just off the main shopping area of kurstdamm with plenty of pubs and cafes nearby supermarket and bakery next door 24hr reception but no bar or restaurant in hotel breakfast provided in rooms on fourth floor good variety of meats cheese fruit and yoghurts tea coffee fruit juices rooms a bit noisy with creaky floor boards and traffic noise

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Greg818
Reviews.Content: We had a large, clean room. The reception staff was attentive. Our room was lacking a safe, a light bulb was out and the shower head needed to be repaired. These matters were corrected promptly. The breakfast buffet on the 4th floor had a huge selection, was delicious and will keep you going until late afternoon. Good view from up there, too. The location is convenient (within one block) to the Ku-damm, the U-station and many restaurants. Our favorite restaurant was Xantener Eck for good German food, one block away. Bathroom with shower was adequate. Berlin was under a deep freeze when we were there and it was a challenge to warm up the room. But then, every place we visited (museums, restaurants) was cold as well.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, clean, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AlieS2
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small but clean and had everything that we needed...comfortable beds and a fully working bathroom. The breakfast buffet was delicious and plentiful! It included eggs, toast, fruit, cereal, yogurt, pastries, etc. The desk staff all spoke English and were very helpful giving us directions and answering any question we had. It's about a block away from a bus stop. I would go back to this hotel anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: holsmanDoncaster
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in August and was travelling on a budget. This hotel offers great value for money, not the most modern of hotels but very clean and spacious rooms. We found the hotel reception staff helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet offered hot and cold food which was fresh and plenty of variety. The hotel is very close to buses and underground train which takes you around this city. I would use this hotel again in the future. Another plus was that there was always loads of hot water for showers etc and a free safe in the room for valuables.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for money, but hard to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBobo
Reviews.Content: No aircondition, me be very sweaty if we didn't open the windows. Outside, trafficed road, lots of noise. :( = Me sleep bad. Huge room though! Adequate bathroom. Breakfast decent. Clean and friendly staff. Helpfull, but when we let them know about our disfunctional safe, they said they would fix it, but didn't! :( (We didn't remind them though, as we weren't too bothered.) Good location for shopping, and close to buses and undergrounds making it an ideal location for... almost everything! Decent hotel, for fairly little money. Would recommend it for the winter season.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: italyfan98
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel. Very friendly staff and free internet access in the lobby. Good sized breakfast which was nice. Clean and comfortable rooms. A good choice for Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: annkannk
Reviews.Content: I was very happy when i arrive this hotell, because of the big room, but that is the only posetive with this hotell. I stayed here with my son (8months) and we didnt get a bed to him the first nigth. We were prommised a minibar on the room to set all our baby food , but we didnt get it! The acces to Internett is very expensitive! I had to pay over 100 Euro in 1 week just to get Internett every day..13euro pr day.. (When you have a litle baby it can be a litle boring to be on the hotell room every nigth.. ) It was hard to get to sleep at nigth because of the loud traffic outside, we wake up many times)! If i had knowed that we wouldnt get a Minibar/cooler in our room i would never choose this hotell.. If you have small children, i hope you will find a another hotell.. I have been in Berlin the last 5years and now we are planning to travel to Berlin again, but i will not choose Agon Olivaer apart hotell again !!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, good value and would return”
Reviews.Author: lynetteoliver
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the hotel for three nights and were very happy with what we got for the price we paid. The rooms are huge and spotless. The beds were lovely and comfortable. The hotel was nearly fully booked but we didn't hear a peep from any of the other rooms or the traffic outside and our window lead out to the main road. The Breakfast was wonderful. There is no bar in the hotel but that does not stop the staff serving you and they do their very best to accommodate you. We didn't pay and high price and I feel we got a little bit more than what we should have done. Thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Basic budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lou2009
Reviews.Content: Just back from Berlin where we stayed at this hotel. It's supposed to be 3 star, but although the room was comfortable and clean, it was very basic. No kettle in the room and only way to get a hot drink was from a vending machine at 1 euro 50 for a cup of vile coffee. Breakfast was the normal continental type and nothing startling. Pub next door was very shabby, dark and dingy. Liked the location though, near lots of restaurants and easy to get around. For what we paid it was adequate but would rather pay bit more next time.

Reviews.Title: “A good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barbara65
Reviews.Content: Booked the Olivaer Apart hotel through Travel Republic for a four night break at a total cost of £88. Room was very warm, clean and comfortable with plenty of hot water. Breakfast was included in the price and was plentiful and varied. The location of the hotel was excellent for easy transport access to all the main visitor sites. We were very satisfied with all aspects of our city break including the Easy Jet flight from Liverpool at an inclusive cost of £46 pounds each. All in all a good value for money break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: jovine
Reviews.Content: This hotel gave excellent value for money. The rooms were clean and comfortable and breakfast was very good. Our room was sometimes on the chilly side, due to the fact it was very big and quite a lot of heat was lost out of the windows. Hot water could be a problem in the mornings when everyone was taking a shower. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom, although quite small, was very clean. The staff were quite friendly and the hotel was well located for shopping, eating out etc. As with past experiences, it would appear that some folk expect too much for what they pay. We were on a fairly cheap and cheerful break and feel we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: RitaDublin
Reviews.Content: A group of 14 which included our elderly parents booked two nights stay at this holet. The rooms ranged from fab to great to ok. Its well worth paying the extra 10 euro to upgrade as the rooms were really lovely. Some of our group stayed on the 1st floor and said there was a strange smell. Our rooms were large warm and clean. Breakfast was an added bonus when it only cost 40 euro each per night . The hotel was very central with a lovely pub next door serving good food and wonderful cocktails !. The staff were helpful and friendly, We were all really impressed with our stay at the hotel, my sister previously stayed in an expensive hotel (150 each per night) and has said the next time she travels to Berlin she would stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Class Trip”
Reviews.Author: kje1985
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Olivaer Apart Hotel in Berlin back in 2003. I had taken German in school for four years so we got the pleasure of going on a tour of Germany. Our first stop was in Berlin and we stayed in this hotel for two nights. Before going to Germany our teacher warned us that we wouldn't be staying in 5 star hotels so we were all expecting something dumpy. I got to stay in a room with two of my best friends. We thought our room was awesome. The whole place looked old and neat. The ceilings were really high and we had hardwood floors in our room. It had a huge window to look out tand a chandelier. We went and visited our classmates rooms and they weren't as neat and big as ours. We did have alot of trouble with our keys though, almost every day, as they were really old. Our room was always very clean and the down blankets were very nice. We stayed in four hotels all throughout Germany and this was our favorite even though we stayed at newer more modern hotels. I would recommend it for a trip of sightseeing or business, but not anything romantic. Depends what your taste is.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leeross
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and daughter in June 2008. Our first impressions were not good. The reception area is old and small. We didn't take the lift so took the stairs to our room. The first two floors are all occupied by doctors rooms along smelly corridors. With trepidation, we opened the door to our room and were surprised to find an enoromous room with a double and single bed, two huge sofas, two wardrobes, table and chairs. The bed linen was white and clean. However there was no kettle and the only option of a cuppa was from the machine in the dingy reception area. There was a very high step into the shower. It was quite dangerous when wet. It certainly would not suit an older person. The breakfast was adequate though the staff seemed unfriendly. The only positive thing about the hotel was the location. It was only 10 minutes walk to the main shopping area, Kurfurstendaam. I would not reccomend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Only the outside is modern”
Reviews.Author: hvlgoddess
Reviews.Content: The inside of the hotel is very old and creeky, and there are also businesses in the building, it is not just a hotel as is advertised. The bathroom, although attractive marble, is full of mold/mildew. The TV did not work and because the woman at the reception desk was quite rude, we didn't want to complain. She didn't really seem to understand English anyhow. The beds were comfortable, and the breakfast that was included was standard European continental. It was difficult to find available tables in the dining room. One other thing, if you take the bus from Tegel airport, when you get to the stop where you get off the bus, the hotel is down the intersecting street on the right. There is another Apart Hotel, but this is not the same one. Make sure the sign says Olivaer.

Reviews.Title: “Find something else”
Reviews.Author: arnesen
Reviews.Content: The receptionists ranged from quite rude (one particular lady) to somewhat helpful (the African man). - There was no ventilation in the sleeping room, there were no fire alarms (isn't this mandatory in the EU?). There was some partying outside the window through the whole week, until 4:30 in the morning and when there is no ventilation, well... - The safe didn't work as described on the note. When I brought this to the staffs attention for the second time, the next to last day we were staying there, I was talked down to. - The bath room floor needed huge repairs as it was damaged by damp. It was so bad that when you stepped on one side of the shower cabinet, the floor visibly raised itself on the other side. It was, to put it mildly, "Squishy". The hotel was placed far away from most of the central sites you would want to see when visiting such a nice city as Berlin, although this is not the staff's fault. I have travelled all over the northern hemisphere for 35 years, on business and vacation, and apart from one hotel in Birmingham, England, I must say that this is the worst hotel I have stayed in ever for that price. Cheap motels in the US and former hotels in Eastern Europe were better than this when you look at what you are paying. But there is one thing positive I can say: The breakfast was very good, with a lot to choose between. If you are vegan, vegetarian, meat eater or whatever, you will find your type of breakfast here. Another plus side was the cleanliness of the chamber maids. But apart from that. Stay away from this hotel. Try something nearer "Stadtmitte" (The middle of the city). Better hotels and better for walking tourists like myself.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere between three and four :-)”
Reviews.Author: Anakin_84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Agon Olivaer Apart Hotel in Berlin during a couple of nights in June. I went there with my brother and we had an excellent time! I certainly cannot complain about the hotel nor the staff. Of course, if you're looking for luxury maybe this may not be the right hotel for you, but i'm not that picky. The room was clean and very big with the biggest windows i ever did see! we stayed on the top floor and had a good view over the rooftops in berlin. The staff was very friendly and helpfull and they all speak English. Nearby you have a foodstore called Keiser's, wich is very convinient if you get hungry but don't want to spend all your money on expensive restuarants. Concerning the nightlife around this area, it was very quiet...and calm, exept from the celebrations after the football games :P just outside the hotel there are a couple of restaurants and they were always occupied with people, but besides from that, it was kinda quiet. The only thing i could complain about is the breakfast...not that we didn't get a lot to choose from, it's just that...well...i get better breakfast at home and the eggs were cold and the coffee tasted like something you've scraped off from a burnt plate or something. In other words...I've had better! The boring part about this part of the city is that there isn't much of a nightlife...and everything felt quite...dead around there... But all in all, the hotel was really good and i do recommend it to anyone who'd like a pleasant stay in berlin (there are transportations to get you around town ;P).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a wonderful City”
Reviews.Author: RHNIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in Feb/March, while yes I will agree with some reviews that parts of the common areas need updating my room was spotlessly clean, and comfortable. Personally I was very happy with my room it was large light and airy. The bathroom was fresh and clean (With a great shower) From hotel there were several restaurants for a lovely meal and easy access to U/S Bahns and Buses Would happily stay here again

Reviews.Title: “old but no complaints”
Reviews.Author: David-QPS
Reviews.Content: I went here with my wife, two sons, daughter and her boyfriend - all adults. We had a double room and a quadruple room. The rooms were fairly basic but clean. They had very high ceilings. The building looks very old and the door lock was sometimes difficult to manipulate and the floors creaked but these were of no great issue. There were two English speaking channels on the TV. We found the double room quiet bit the quadruple, which overlooked the intersection, ws a little noisy. The double beds were the typical European style, like two singles pushed together. One of the beds in the quadruple room was a sofa bed but I don't recall my son complaining about it. There was no kettle, tea or coffeem which we would have liked. We found the pillows were very soft. The receptionists were very good and very helpful. They looked up information on the internet for us and, on one night when we had taken dinner back to the room with us, the receptionist just gave us the keys to the kitchen so we could get some cutlery. The hotel is close to the main street (Kudenaffendamme?) and we had no trouble walking to the main centres although there were convenient UBahns if you wanted them. There is a grocery store next door and a fruit shop, pizza restaurant and pasta place within two blocks. Breakfast was very good for a three star hotel. There was cereal, breads, scrambled and boiled eggs, cheese, assorted fruits, yoghurt, assorted meats, tea, coffee and hot chocolate. I have attached a couple of photos of the quadruple room.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, good location”
Reviews.Author: kimerama
Reviews.Content: Great location right off main shopping strip and close to public transport. Airport is also close, like 15 minute drive. Unique hotel with castle-like corridors and high ceilings. Bathrooms updated and free breakfast covers most bases. I had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: forwarddeployed
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel. Rooms were nicely sized. Its nicely located on Ku'Damm, but can be a bit of a haul to get to the Mitte. The rooms were clean, service was efficient. Breakfast was nice and filling. (Avoid the coffee. Think of the taste of burned kidney beans in liquid form.) Considering the cost of hotel rooms in Berlin, this was an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: patrickhw
Reviews.Content: this hotel was great in almost every way. the rooms were large (we paid for a "regular room" and it was the size of a small suite), and had plenty of furniture, including a couch and coffee table. the bathroom was done in marble and had a walk-in shower, which was nice. there was a balcony looking out into a courtyard below us, and the walls of the courtyard were covered in ivy, it was beautiful. there was complimentary breakfast every morning which was great, and there is also wireless internet throughout the hotel, although it is not free. it's of the sort of hotel where upon leaving you just drop your key into a slot at the front desk so you don't have to worry about carrying it around. very nice if you are going out drinking and have a tendency to lose things. there is also a grocery right next to the hotel, and it is about a minute or two walk to the nearest bus stop or u-bahn (subway) station. overall a great value, and i would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and Clean!!”
Reviews.Author: shazel
Reviews.Content: On arrival at Olivaer Apartments we were greeted by extremely friendly staff at the front desk.The foyer area is very bland and brown looking, most of this apartment building is original fittings from what im guessing would be at least 50 years old..dont worry it looks antique like..not falling apart!! We stayed in a tripple room which was very clean and spacious. We had 2 balconies which over looked the street below. The beds were comfortable and we had a couch that also folded out. the bathroom was very small but did the job! Restaurants are very close and one bus can be caught down to the main city. Breakfast is served in the morning with a large variety of meats and cereals available. Free internet is also supplied in the main foyer.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Janne_HEL
Reviews.Content: Nice, peacefull and clean little hotel. Not the fanciest place in Berlin but quite a reasonable choice for both business and leisure travellers. If you grab a good bargain like I did, this place suits even for budget travellers. Very good location near the Kurfurstendamm shopping boulevard, just couple of steps away from the local Louis Vuitton and Bentley dealers ; )

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: Kyrarini
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT VALUE for a 3* hotel! BERLIN is an amazing huge city with high respect of humans and animals. I wish all cities being so friendly and civilised as Berlin. We spent 6 nights with friends, all coming from Greece. The building is a bit old and need some renovation but we loved it as it is, looks very classic! Rooms are very clean, we had 2 huge rooms with big windows and a lot of space to move around. Bathrooms are renovated and the shower excellent. Breakfast was rich and fresh with excellent coffee. The staff is very kind and helpful - specially the night receptionists. The area (Kudam) is very nice and safe (it's in west Berlin) you can walk around at night and nothing would scare you. We usually get back very late (2 women) and had no problem. The tub stop is 5 minutes walk from the hotel. There is an excellent italian piano restaurant opposite the hotel the food and the service and the pianist are great and we found it very cheap for our standards in Greece. Try it! We wouldn't expect any better for what we paid. We would stay there again. Niki Kyrarini, Eirini Lazana, Romeo Rousseau, Nikos Athanassoulas from Athens Greece

Reviews.Title: “Amongst a decent choice for Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MyLSD
Reviews.Content: Berlin is huge as it is, so we were just wanting a nice hotel in a decent location that would give us access to the many attractions Berlin has to offer. The was conveniently within walking distance of Kurfurstendamm. There were a number of eatery options also within walking distance. We tried out Kaffeehaus Berlin, when we first got there, they were about to close at that time because we got in so late, but the service was nice, the food was decent (considering it was the last patron)... and of course - drink the beer! The room was very clean and quite spacious for European standards. It was cute, with modern looking furniture and a flat, but still comfortable bed. The bathroom was a bit out-dated, but was still clean and served its purpose. By the way, the toilet is LOUD. =P The hotel had a large lobby area with Internet access. There was breakfast included in our booking and it was more on the average side compared to some of the other breakfasts we had on our trip in other cities. From our hotel, we were able to walk to many of the attractions closest to us, for the others, we bought tickets for the hop on/hop off buses. With that, we were able to see ALL of Berlin, since it is such a huge city. Shopping on Kurfurstendamm was much more high end, but didn't compare to Paris' Champs de E. Walking down the long street full of musuems was interesting, and also allowed us to wander through a couple of flea markets as well. You definitely need a good few days in Berlin if you want to cover it all. But the Olivaer Apart Hotel was perfect for our trip. It was in a good location, the building seemed safe and secure, breakfast fed us, and we were on our way!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel very good”
Reviews.Author: fatboy40
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable and very clean.Breakfast was very good with lots of choices in cheeses and cooked meats,cereals,yoghurt and fruit juices and hot scrambled egg and sausage and boiled eggs also. Staff were friendly and polite. The hotel is situated in a very affluent area of Berlin and easily reachable from public transport. For a good meal i can recommend you try the Hell and Dunkel (light and dark) refering to the type of beer they sell. It is 2 min walk from the hotel. Turn left,walk 10 yards to corner,turn right and walk about 200 yards. You are there. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: gazcam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an old 1920's building. Our rooms were on the top floor and were modern. Both had lovely big balconies with a view over Konstanzer Strasse. The road was quite busy but it didn't bother us at all. Nice big bathroom and there was a good choice at breakfast. The hotel could do with a fresh lick of paint in the corridors and in the breakfast room but all in all when you consider the price it is very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Just about acceptable”
Reviews.Author: denshires
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel much in need of refurbishment. The bed and shower room were clean, but the sofas in the room were very grubby, the sink was cracked, the shower door was hanging off. Also the carpets in the corridors were stained. Not my idea of a pleasant hotel. The breakfast was OK but it was a real bun fight with tables very close together and someone knocking the back of your chair every so often. There is no air conditioning and we were overlooking the main road so it was very noisy. The bar which a reviewer mentioned is called QBA and although it was noisy I would recommend a visit! It is a cuban bar and serves great cocktails with a great atmosphere. The location is good - nice area and close to excellent public transport. Conclusion? - Fairly cheap but not that cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from berlin. Stayed 2 nights at the olivaer apart hotel. The hotel was in a really nice area around 3 miles from mitte which is where all the historical monuments are. Mitte is easily reachable from the hotel from either Charlottenburg S-bahn (10min walk) or the Zoologisher Garten S-Bahn (30 min walk). The hotel reception and corridors need touching up, but the room we stayed in was great. We had a huge balcony and a really nicely laid out room. Breakfast is very good and the staff were quite friendly. Berlin is ace and we are going back shortly and will definetly stay in the olivaer apart hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - fantastic breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SHickson
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was brilliant, just around the corner from the U-Bahn station and the Ku'damm main street where there are plenty of bars and restaurants. The rooms were clean and spacious with nice high ceilings and french doors. The breakfast was great, with a really good selection of cold meats, cheeses, different kinds of bread and fruit. It was also served until 10am for a nice lie-in. The only complaint is that the rooms are very noisy, the hotel is right by the main road which is constantly busy so it wasn't possible to have the windows open at night. There is also a busy bar right next door to the hotel, but the noise from there generally stopped by about midnight. Overall very good value for money, but probably not a good choice if you are a light sleeper!

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 4 nights at Olivaer Apart. It is located in a very convenient area, very near to Ku'dam avenue, near metro and bus stations. We mostly used the buses which are the best way to see the town and Berlin's most important sights. As for the room, it was large and very clean, though the decor could have been updated. Best part of the story, the breakfast, which makes up for any incoveniences the hotel may have: great variety of food and bakery products(you will love the hams and cheeses), even light products for those on diet. And, very important to me, excellent coffee and juices (difficult to find decent ones even in 4* hotels). All in all, I would recommend this hotel for its great value for money and its convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from a trip to Berlin and stayed at the Olivaer. The breakfasts were great - all you could eat and it was filled up on a regular basis. The room was clean and tidy with a lovely bathroom (bath and shower). The hotel staff were OK, although we found it a bit strange that they were smoking on the reception desk! In terms of location, this is a perfect place to stay, as it is right by the U-Bahn (Adenauerplatz) and you can stroll along the Ku'damm towards the Europa Center and KadeWe.

Reviews.Title: “great location & great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for one night on August 29th 2005. What fantastic value. It cost us £92 for two rooms..WITH breakfast. The rooms were exceptionally clean…as was the rest of the Hotel…staff were friendly and helpful…and there is free internet access. The location is great…about 10-15 mins walk from the zoological gardens and right in the heart of the main shopping district

Reviews.Title: “not the best for the value”
Reviews.Author: AlexanderKarls
Reviews.Content: spent one night here. let me say, that for the price, you will find better hotels in this location, just look round the subway station olivaer platz or take walk down ku-damm. the "bed" was a sofa, no pillows in room and the staff is slighly creepy. first and last stay here

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not Cheerfull!”
Reviews.Author: lancashire_lass34
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderfull weekend in Berlin staying at the above hotel. The receptionist definately needs to attend a customer care course, she was very ignorant, rude and not at all helpful, and smoking behind the counter was like walking into fog!!! The room was clean and comfortable, breakfast was plentiful. Decent location for underground and bus services.

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Bintang
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Olivaer Apart Hotel for two nights / three days B&B in April. The first things we noticed was how miserable the recepeptionist was!! None of the staff were that friendly in fact. When we reached our room, however, we were more than happy with what we'd got. We had a twin room with two single beds which was spotlessly clean and overlooked a small courtyard. There are no tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms for those of you who like a coffee first thing!?!? We booked the hotel via the internet and got a good deal but having checked out the hotel's prices I don't think we would have paid what they wanted..... There is a U-bahn and bus stop not far from the hotel but to get to all the sights / tourist places it's a 15 minute journey by either. The underground is easier to use than London and it's very cheap!! 2 euros for one ticket which lasts you 2 hours on any form of public transport. Just across from the hotel is a lovely square with pavement cafe's which do the most delicious food! We spent both nights eating at these restaurants which I can definitely recommend. All in all, if I went back to Berlin for a sight seeing trip and could get the hotel at the same cheap rate I would definitely stay there. It is ideal if all you're after is a clean room to get your head down but does not offer much more. Breakfast is a typical continental breakfast with plenty to eat - couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: m0llers
Reviews.Content: The room we got was huge and the breakfast was very tasty. All in all very good value for money although a couple of negatives were (a) we got two single beds pushed together instead of a double, (b) the pillows were non-existant and (c) the curtains didnt quite meet in the middle and we had to fix them shut with hair pins.

Reviews.Title: “God NOoooo!!”
Reviews.Author: AthensGeorgia
Reviews.Content: We arrived there mid November. The first thing I noticed was how UNFRIENDLY and RUDE the staff were. They gave you the impression that you were not a paying customer and they made you a favour having you there. My room was ok comparing to my friend's room, although I had requested for a double bed and...I found two twin beds!! Breakfast was basic but even there the staff were watching how much coffee we would drink!!!!!The location is not good either. I would NEVER go there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Agon Olivaer Apart Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Konstanzerstrasse 1, 10707 Berlin, Germany
